intro: Calyptranthes corymbosa, commonly known as the white mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other aromatic plants such as eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its dense, white or pale green foliage and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments. The leaves are typically used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
